# Second National Assembly of the Batavian Republic

, Binnenhof, The Hague
| election              = 1797 Batavian general election
| government            =
| opposition            =
| term_start            =
| term_end              =
| before                = First National Assembly
| after                 = Constituent Assembly

| chamber1_image_size   =

The Second National Assembly () was the term between 1797 and 1798 of the National Assembly of the Batavian Republic. The Second National Assembly was elected in the 1797 Batavian general election. The assembly was responsible for governing the new republic as well as writing a constitution, after the previous proposal was rejected in the 1797 referendum. It was replaced by the Constituent Assembly after the January 1798 coup d'etat.
